laboratory_examinations.findings: Serial interictal EEG showed independent bitemporal spikes, and bilateral posterior sharp and slow activity appearing immediately after eye closure.

SPS were associated with fast rhythms over both occipital areas; CPS were accompanied by rhythmic slow activity mainly over the posterior quadrants with variable but more consistent left-sided emphasis.

Confirmed increased frequency of habitual seizures with posterior rhythmic slowing evolving into regional spiking; recorded a new seizure type with pseudorhythmic sharp delta activity over the posterior temporal and occipital areas.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Post-VNS, new seizure type ceased and habitual seizures settled down to the preimplantation baseline.
